positive.review: I was always on the fence with crosshairs, usually defaulting to in game one, but most games when aiming without a scope will make crosshairs disapear. I bought and downloaded Crosshair X and it has helped my PvP game more than I would like to admit.
Great app. make sure to check open on startup in app settings. Great for rust farming since pickaxes dont give crosshair.
It does its job. Sometimes the crosshair just doesn't show even when game bar overlay is already on but a simple restart of the program fixes it.
its a great game for games that don't necesserialy have a crosshair, but have guns. it definitely gives you an advantage in combat with its highly customizable crosshairs.

Crosshair X works good on anything tbh i use it for my fiveM/gta stuff and sometimes it dont work but half the time it does honestly would recemond this app 

youll never get better then this tbh
if you play games in which this can be considered useful, it is definitely the best choice out there. for 2,49 on a sale, i cannot say i regret buying it.
it is worth for its cheap price, u get any crosshair on any game

It takes a bit of playing around to get it to turn on sometimes (usually isn't difficult to figure out though, and is probably due to windows game bar functionality).  It's wonderful having the choice of crosshair though and there are so many choices.  You can favorite the ones you use.  There is probably more to the app, but I haven't explored because I found the crosshair I like and I just use that.
Pretty useful tool for games w awful crosshair (like rust) and what it helps for only 5‚Ç¨  i would recomend it 100%
Spoilt for choice here,i love this and leave it on 24/7   100x better than the FREE Version. which is also good imho this is the logical progressor
Its so amazing it puts a little dot in the middle of your screen.
Really good just wish they could fix a slight delay issue with the mouse. It feels heavy when i use it but overall still good.

I absolutely love it! It has significantly improved my aim, and after trying several similar tools, I can confidently say this is one of the best if not the best pieces of software for enhancing aiming skills. The training routines are well designed, the feedback is clear, and the overall experience makes practice both effective and enjoyable. Highly recommended for anyone looking to take their aim to the next level

It is a useful tool, loving it so far. A lot of the community crosshairs are great, and having a consistent crosshair across all games helps me feel more consistent (particularily with deadlock because the crosshair customization in that game is severely lacking).
yep i like it better than my monitor crosshair recommended. ive been using it for 5000 hrs, its good
I mainly use this for rust, but its kinda useless after rust released the update with the crosshair, but still money well spent
with 3k hours i can proudly say that the software is great, and for all the people saying "just get crosshairv2 its free" big diffrence between them bud.

I never thought i would buy this because i thought paying money for something as simple as a crosshair was stupid. but its honestly worth it, i get way more use out of it than i thought. Its worth a try.
Very useful for playing games with no crosshair to enable, the ability to use a variety of different shapes and colours as well as being able to place the crosshair anywhere you desire is very nice.
Awesome for all FPS games like valorant, rust, cs, and even fortnite and marvel rivals
it is very goodand works very consistently. and itworks to help my aim
honestly its so good u get used to one crosshair and just use it for all games i doesnt improve gamesence or anything but def improves aim after some time
absolutely worth it, fantastic and easy to use all around. I suggest making a sticky note or something to remind yourself to turn it on before going into a game
Crosshair X is a amazing app for crosshairs a lot of options and overall very amazing! 5/5
very useful for same crosshair across multiple games
amazing for games that support it. I love the customization options and how it allows me to customize my cursors
makes me super tuff and i still suck at rust but its okay because i use mr goat snowmers crosshair
I would have been nice if this software would launch without also launching the steam app.
works well and launches on startup seamlessly. there‚Äôs plenty of community crosshairs to pick from and edit to ur own standards, just a neat app
the best thing to get your aim better i recommend this app to help you with the aiming on any battle royale games and others 10/10 for me
This game is kind of boring, I thought I would able to build and shi but there isnt even a battlepass to get new skins
Good Crosshairs. I recently started using this and it is quite good. The crosshairs are nice and good for aim. I like how there are crosshairs from different games. Works with any FPS game!
its nice but chould'v been a little better and more a coller insted of a big blure
good crosshairs but if you alt tab sometimes your game wont open back up
Helped me a lot in many games such as Rust and Fortnite, I would strongly recommend buying Crosshair X to improve your aim in games with shitty crosshair system.

It's alright... but Game Bar is trash, will never touch it. Only upgraded from the free version to get fullscreen support, only to be backdoored by 'you must use Game Bar'... anything but that, please. Can't decide whether I recommend or not, it's opinion-based.

After a recent update, it no longer auto detects my game... Tried a reset, tried to add it again, tried game bar mode, nothing works. "Only show in-game" doesn't work, my game is Rainbow Six Vegas 2. Edit: It's fixed, thank you

I've only used this with two games, Witchfire and Battlefield 6, and it has definitely saved the experience for both of those games. Highly worth if you get bothered by large low definition crosshairs.
interesting makes your aim 1% better but dont think you will be going from shit to peterbot level you wont but overall its good

Has been given great updates, now the user interface is refined and well-executed.

[b] Worth it for price. [/b]

Works with any game you want it to! (It's good for Rust)

Crosshair X is a solid tool for custom crosshairs in popular games. It works well and offers a wide range of options. You get clean crosshairs for general use and some advanced ones too.

Valorant has two recoil crosshairs in the app. One only shows upward recoil direction. This is safe and will not get you banned. The other shows the exact recoil pattern of a specific gun. Riot said any product that gives a gameplay advantage could cause a ban. So using a pattern-based crosshair is risky.

There is also a one-tap headshot crosshair. It only helps you line up shots, so it is allowed.

Buy it for general crosshairs. Skip the ones that show exact recoil or make aiming unfair. Games like Rust, Valorant, CS2, and Fortnite allow basic overlays, but not anything that gives a strong edge.
i love this app because it helped me improve in games like fortnite, cs2, etc.

fun gameplay.
10/10 story
10/10 graphics 

overall worth it
people call it bad but i would miss often in shooting games now i just hit flicks and long range shots naturally (changed my skills in 1 day basically) combine this with scope x and its op
veryy gooddddd i use this for bassically all my games i likke the moveing crosshairs or nazi just for fun bought myself i kinda want scope x now

I‚Äôve spent some time with this game and honestly, it surprised me in a way I didn‚Äôt fully expect. I don‚Äôt want to sound dramatic, but there‚Äôs something oddly satisfying about how everything fits together ‚Äî not in some perfect, polished ‚Äúadvertisement‚Äù way, but more like a game that knows exactly what it wants to be and just‚Ä¶ goes for it.

The first thing I noticed is the atmosphere. Every part of the game ‚Äî the visuals, the sound, the pacing ‚Äî kind of blends into this feeling that you‚Äôre actually inside its world, even if you‚Äôre just casually playing. I know that sounds a bit clich√©, but it‚Äôs true. Sometimes it‚Äôs chaotic, sometimes slow, sometimes you‚Äôre just wandering around thinking ‚Äúok, what now?‚Äù but that‚Äôs honestly part of the charm. The game doesn‚Äôt try to rush you unless it actually needs to.

Gameplay-wise, it has this mix of familiar elements and small twists that keep things from feeling stale. Nothing groundbreaking, maybe, but it all works together in a way that feels natural. There were moments when I thought ‚Äúyeah, I‚Äôve seen this in other games,‚Äù but then the game throws in tiny details or unexpected interactions that make it stand out just enough. It‚Äôs the kind of thing you only notice after a few hours, when you start connecting the dots.

Performance has been mostly fine. A little rough spot here and there, but honestly, show me a game these days that doesn‚Äôt have something weird happening once in a while. Nothing game-breaking on my end, at least. You can clearly tell the developers put effort into this, even if a few edges are still a bit sharp. Again ‚Äî part of the charm.

What I really appreciate is that the game gives you space to play the way you want. Some people will rush through every objective, others will take their time exploring or messing around, and both approaches actually feel valid. I like games that don‚Äôt punish you for not following some ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù path.

Overall, I‚Äôd say this is one of those titles that grows on you the longer you play. It doesn‚Äôt try too hard to impress in the first five minutes ‚Äî instead it slowly builds its identity, layer by layer, until you suddenly realize you‚Äôve been playing way longer than you planned. If you‚Äôre looking for something that balances comfort with challenge, familiar mechanics with fresh touches, and a world that‚Äôs just fun to be in, then I genuinely think this one is worth giving a shot.

Would I recommend it?
Yeah, I would ‚Äî maybe not to everyone, because no game is for everyone, but definitely to anyone who likes getting lost in a game for a bit and discovering things at their own pace.
Honestly, it‚Äôs a great help for games with no crosshair or a crosshair that‚Äôs off the axis

Very buggy, glitchy, sometimes it doesn't even work at all.

DO NOT BUY THIS CRAP
for some reason i have it set to dont start on start up but it still starts when i turn on my pc

Extremely unnecessary purchase, works great and does it's job but I am 100% sure there are free alternatives. The only reason I still have this and didn't refund it, is because it booted with my computer and when I noticed I already had over 2 hours.
its just bad, the crosshair always not correct and at a wrong location a round 1 1.5 pixel idk, but this is a bad software dont buy it

Oh my god does this app SUCK! Whatever I do 'Launch on Start' disables itself, what is that a UI error? No Error Message just doesn't do anything.

Adjusted the position of my crosshair for it to not save to the profile??? Then Can't update it because the name exists already? What a half baked application.

Not to mention it CLASHES WITH THE SCOPE ONE, ITS SISTER PROGRAM.
I thought QUAKE would be a satisfactory testing ground, gave me all the unfortunate results I needed.
Ads say you will not get banned on games while using it... I got a permanent ban for a 3rd party software while using it.

Can't center my crosshair.

Crosshair disappear mid-game.

*Edit after another 70 hours using this*

Still butt cheeks.

[b]This software is widely used for providing unauthorized aiming assistance[/b], granting users an [b]unfair competitive advantage[/b] in first-person shooter games that [b]intentionally lack a visible crosshair[/b] (e.g., Rust prior to the crosshair update, Insurgency, Bodycam, Escape from Tarkov, and similar titles). [b]Its primary function[/b] is to [b]bypass intentional gameplay mechanics[/b] intended to emphasize skill, recoil control, and spatial awareness.
